isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - DISASSEMBLE - SHIFTER HOUSING

step1.para: Tilt the assembly and remove the three sets of tension springs and balls from the housing bores ( Figure 155).

figure.caption: Figure 155. Remove Tension Springs and Balls From Housing Bores

step1.para: Secure the assembly in a vise with the plunger-side up ( Figure 156). (The front of the housing will be to the left.) For models so equipped, cut the lockwire and turn out the retaining bolts to remove the oil trough from the housing.

note.para: Start with the upper shift bar and move all bars to the right and out the rear boss bore. Cut the lockwire and remove the bolts from each bar just before their removal.

step1.para: Move the 3rd-4th speed shift bar to the housing rear, removing the yoke and block from the bar ( Figure 157).

figure.caption: Figure 157. Remove Yoke and Block From 3rd-4th Speed Shift Bar

step1.para: Move the 1st-2nd speed shift bar to the housing rear, removing the yoke and block from the bar. As the neutral notch in the bar clears the rear boss, remove the small interlock pin from the bore ( Figure 158).

figure.caption: Figure 158. Remove Yoke and Block From 1st-2nd Speed Shift Bar

step1.para: Remove the actuating plunger from the center boss bore ( Figure 159).

Move the short LO-Reverse speed shift bar to the housing rear and remove the yoke from the bar. As the shift bar is removed from the housing, two 3/4 inch interlock balls will drop from the rear boss bottom bore ( Figure 160).

figure.caption: Figure 160. Interlock Balls Drop From Rear Boss Bottom Bore

step1.para: If necessary, remove the plug, spring, and reverse-stop plunger from the LO-Reverse speed shift yoke bore ( Figure 161).

figure.caption: Figure 161. Remove Plug, Spring, and Reverse-Stop Plunger
